main_definition: A young person who is in the stage of development between childhood and adulthood, typically ranging from ages 10 to 19.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The period of transition from childhood to adulthood
meanings_and_examples.example: During the adolescent years, many individuals begin to experience significant physical, emotional and social changes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person in their teenage years, typically between 13-19 years old
meanings_and_examples.example: Jane is an adolescent who recently entered high school and is navigating the challenges of this transitional period.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The stage in human development that follows childhood but precedes full-fledged adulthood
meanings_and_examples.example: Adolescence is a critical time for developing identity, independence and preparing for the responsibilities of adult life.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The specific age range typically considered as part of adolescence (10-19 years old)
meanings_and_examples.example: In many societies, individuals aged 12 to 18 are considered adolescents and face unique challenges associated with this stage.
